content.description: The figure above represents the horizontal electric field that exists near the center of two long, vertical parallel plates close to Earth’s surface. The electric field has magnitude <math alttext="2000 newtons per coulomb" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>2000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>C</mtext></math>, and the plates are separated by <math alttext="0.04 meter" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>0.04</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math>. A small object with a mass of <math alttext="4.4 times 10 raised to the negative 8 kilogram" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>4.4</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></math> and a charge of <math alttext="negative 8.3 times 10 raised to the negative 11 power coulomb" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>−</mo><mn>8.3</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>11</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>C</mtext></math> is released at a point midway between the plates.
content.question: What is the absolute value of the potential difference between the plates?

choices.label: <math alttext="80 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>80</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></math>
<math alttext="8 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>8</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></math>
<math alttext="4 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="80 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>80</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
